channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA

item.title: Report I-2023060039
item.description:
Report I-2023060039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: Seattle
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 5/5/23, DL468 (SEA-RDU) during flight, a passenger seated in 27D alerted the Flight Attendants that their power bank was overheating. The Flight Attendants observed the device to be smoking around row 27. The Flight Attendant applied water and the smoke dissipated shortly thereafter. The Flight Attendant then placed the power bank in a fire suppression bag with water. The flight continued to RDU without further incident and no injuries were reported. See the attached pictures.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was brought to QA by belt manager as package was wet. upon inspection it was found that contents were leaking at cap. DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was put into hazmat bag inside of plastic tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060509
item.description:
Report X-2023060509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded from a trailer and the package handler noticed that the package was slightly wet. They placed it on the ground and grab a manager. QA was called and the package was placed in a red hazmat tote lined with a hazmat bag. DescribePack: The ventilation cap at the top of the bottle leaked during shipment. No holes can be seen. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote lined with a bag to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023060239
item.description:
Report E-2023060239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: MOUNT VERNON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of isopropyl alcohol (un1219) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023060206
item.description:
Report X-2023060206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found package inside a hazmat tote. The external of the box was wet with closures open. Upon inspection discovered that the package contained 4 - 1 gallon jugs of 70% isopropyl alcohol. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap and an unsealed seal causing the liquid to leak through. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023050781
item.description:
Report X-2023050781

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in QA when the Preload shift came in so this was during OTP. The package was wet and was going to need an inspection. HAzBags were placed on the drum to prevent any odors from escaping. DescribePack: I could not locate the failure areas but it was leaking very slowly. Haz bags were placed to prevent further leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: haz bags were placed over the box because it did not fit in a red tub.

item.title: Report X-2023050754

Report X-2023050754

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was discovered to be leaking during unloading. Package was placed in a red hazmat bin immediately DescribePack: Package contained multiple different Items, one of which was a hazmat aerosol can that seemed to be leaking from the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put in a red hazmat bin with a lid and brought to QA to mitigate the effects of release

item.title: Report X-2023050716
item.description:
Report X-2023050716

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON) WAS PUT ON AND PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO A YELLOW TUB/ DMP BAG. PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE DECONTAMINATED AND PACKAGE WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023050661
item.description:
Report X-2023050661

  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN LEAKER, RESPONDER ARRIVED TO CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID BOX MOVED OUT OF TRAILER BY LOADER. HAZMAT CONTINUED TO LEAK. RESPONDER PICKED UP HAZMAT RETURNED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023050441
item.description:
Report X-2023050441

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A HAZMAT BIN WITH A HAZMAT LINER AND PLACED INTO A UPRIGHT POSITION. LID WAS ALSO TIGHTEN TO HELP MITIGATE ANY FURTHER LEAK. DescribePack: PACKAGE FAILURE WAS THE LACK OF INNER PACK PROTECTING THE PRODUCT FROM EXTERIOR COLLISION. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A HAZMAT BIN WITH A HAZMAT LINER AND PLACED INTO A UPRIGHT POSITION. LID WAS ALSO TIGHTEN TO HELP MITIGATE ANY FURTHER LEAK.

item.title: Report X-2023050288
item.description:
Report X-2023050288

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 6AM Unload radioed a hazmat is leaking. QA responded and investigated the leaking hazmat. There was a strong odor coming from the hazmat. The area was cleared of package handlers. placed the hazmat in a red tote lined with a hazardous materials bag. DescribePack: The cap loosened during shipment causing 1 can to be completely empty. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote lined with a hazardous materials bag.
